title: Charles Symmons
bio:
It’s no secret that technology can unlock new sources of competitive advantage. Charlie holds the keys—with a unique combination of emerging technology experience and commercial insight that translates to success. He led the redesign and transformation of digital channels—including websites, mobile, apps, billboards, and interactive kiosks—for a national news organization that drove a three-times increase in traffic and revenue.

His expertise doesn’t just include product management. He’s also skilled in program, people, team, financial, and change management, as well as executive communications and business strategy/alignment—all factors in successful transformation. His experience spans projects and organizations across North America, Europe, and Africa.

Charlie has parlayed his strong entrepreneurial spirit into several businesses and digital start-ups, ranging from video production for online and mobile channels to designer 3D glasses.

Charlie joined West Monroe in 2024. He previously spent 25 years with Accenture, most recently creating, managing, and growing the Digital Products practice in North America. He earned a Bachelor of Science degree in psychology from Edinburgh University.
differentiation: Charlie has a passion for art and paints as a hobby. He is also published in the Journal of Paranormal Psychology. Other interests include cooking, cycling, golf, yoga, and horseback riding. He once went on a horse trek in the mountains of Lesotho in Africa.
impact:
He is committed to making the workplace accessible. He has served as a disability employee resource group lead and encouraged the launch of accessibility centers with specialized tools and technologies. 

He also has a passion for innovations that drive trust and safety in ethical technology products.
short_bio: Known for deep product management skills and mindset, Charlie guides his clients through digital transformation to realize tangible financial value.

title: Cristhian García
bio:
As the Costa Rica office leader, Cristhian knows what it takes to build high-performing teams of engineers and motivate them to deliver impact for clients—fast and efficiently. He implemented a reverse engineering project to insource third-party product support for a technology company, generating over $1 million in savings within nine months, improving the product reliability and reducing customers downtime

He can see the big picture but also dive deep into the details. With a passion for innovation, he can set aside old paradigms and think outside the box to solve business problems. But what he really loves is getting down to work and seeing solutions through to results. He believes nothing is impossible when people have the will to make things work.

He has built and developed teams large and small, and is accustomed to global, fast-paced, and high-growth environments. 

He joined West Monroe in 2023 from NI (National Instruments), where he led the Professional Services Delivery team in Costa Rica, providing software development services to NI’s customers. He holds and electronics engineering degree from Instituto Tecnologico de Costa Rica and is an MBA candidate and Six Sigma Black Belt.
differentiation: Cristhian spends most of his spare time with his young son, but he will jump at any opportunity to spend time outdoors hiking or relaxing near a natural body of water—lake, river or sea. His favorite thing is nature, and he loves being able to see and visit big green mountains year around. He has twice climbed Cerro Chirripó, the tallest mountain in Costa Rica at 12,536 feet.
impact: Cristhian values working in an organization with a strong culture of corporate social responsibility. He always pushes himself and his teams to get involved in and give back to the community—whether that is mentoring female high school students to pursue STEM careers or helping with maintenance in Costa Rica’s national parks.
short_bio: As West Monroe’s Costa Rica office lead, Cristhian oversees a team of engineers who deliver digital products that clients and customers love.

global_field.meta_description: As West Monroe’s Costa Rica office lead, Cristhian oversees a team of engineers who deliver digital products that clients and customers love.

title: Fred Purdue
bio:
Understanding technology is at the heart of executing a successful transaction. That’s where Fred comes in. Over the past decade, his teams have completed more than 800 diligence projects and planned and delivered some 50 carveouts and complex mergers. He’s also partnered with hundreds of companies to define transaction-related IT strategies and technology roadmaps. 

Fred got into technology early—he was a UNIX administrator by night in high school—and never slowed down. As a senior technology executive with experience as a CEO, CTO, and professional services practice leader, he has a unique understanding of private equity investors and the needs of their portfolio companies.

Over his career, Fred has built and operated several managed services and professional services organizations. He has experience managing technology initiatives for companies ranging from small businesses to upper-middle market enterprises. His expertise spans all facets of IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, IT governance, and managed services.

Prior to joining West Monroe, Fred was a founding partner and CEO at Axiom Technology Group. He led the sale of Axiom in 2021 to another managed services provider. He also ran and grew the IT Infrastructure & Cybersecurity practice at a private-equity focused professional services firm.
differentiation: Fred started his first business in the eighth grade, buying computer equipment from the back of catalogs and then reselling it to the parents of classmates and installing it for a fee. He is an avid reader who averages over 150 books per year. He enjoys traveling with his family—he’s been to 30 of 50 states. He also likes being out in the wilderness and is building an off-grid cabin in Maine.
impact: As a member of Renaissance Executive Forum, he advises CEOs of more than a dozen Connecticut-based businesses. He’s also active in a Massachusetts-based organization that supports refugees relocating to the United States. He personally provides computers to program participants who do not have one.
short_bio: Leveraging experience as a CEO and CTO, Fred helps private equity firms and their portfolio companies navigate carveouts and complex mergers.

global_field.meta_description: Leveraging experience as a CEO and CTO, Fred helps private equity firms and their portfolio companies navigate carveouts and complex mergers.

title: Alex Foucré-Stimes
bio:
Alex’s specialty is keeping people at the center of his problem solving, ensuring everyone feels heard, valued, and recognized on any team he’s a part of.

Alex’s track record as a Customer Experience expert speaks for itself, with more than a decade’s worth of success stories in digital user experience design and marketing across an array of industries.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2011, Alex was an interactive designer with CAHG and a creative assistant with Vitamin Pictures. He has a bachelor’s degree from DePaul University.
differentiation: With a background in design, Alex brings a sense of artistry to everything from customer experience to building forts with his daughter in the basement of their Downers Grove home. And his work hasn’t gone unnoticed; he recently won an award from Nielsen Norman Group for Con Edison's "Conor" digital workplace intranet.
impact: Alex is an Agile and Scrum practitioner and evangelist within West Monroe. He led the charge on an award-winning digital workplace that saved his client more than $9 million for its improved search, speed, and efficiency for employees.
short_bio: Alex is an award-winning expert on designing and implementing digital workplaces.

title: Amie Richards
bio:
Amie is passionate about data-driven decision making and empowering organizations to use their data efficiently. No wonder – she has seen first-hand the impact it has. She has worked with a number of organizations of varying size and maturity to implement strategic data and analytics programs that drive the business forward. In one role, she transitioned disparate operational and planning analysts into a centralized business analytics team, upskilled the team’s technical and visualization skills, and consolidated the reporting suite by 70%, increasing self-service and user acceptance across the business. 

She believes success breeds success. So, she aims to create repeatable processes, frameworks, and reference material that build on previous wins. This philosophy has been key to breaking down data silos and building analytics capabilities that answer business problems and enable data-driven decision making. 

She is an ambitious and highly proficient business analytics executive with multi-industry experience in data and analytics strategy, data storytelling, statistical analysis, and solution design. She collaborates effectively across functions to manage stakeholders, implement efficient processes, and ensure exceptional delivery. 

She joined West Monroe from Zovio, where she was director of business analytics, responsible for leading the operational planning and forecasting process. She earned a bachelor’s degree in political science and a Master of Public Administration emphasizing in quantitative policy analysis from the University of Utah, along with multiple Microsoft certifications.
differentiation: Most weekends, you can find Amie playing softball. She appreciates that the weather where she lives allows her to do so year-round. She has five rescue cats: Kamri, Zoe, Bella, Mya, and Loki.
impact: In each of her prior roles, she has succeeded in building new functional teams and enabling new practice areas.
short_bio: An expert data storyteller, Amie has worked across industries to break down data silos and build analytics capabilities that can answer business problems.

global_field.meta_description: An expert data storyteller, Amie has worked across industries to break down data silos and build analytics capabilities that can answer business problems.

title: Andrew Sordi
bio:
Andy is an accomplished enterprise architect with experience working across the healthcare landscape. Through his architecture work, Andy has developed a reputation as a trusted advisor who solves complex problems providing actionable strategies and outcome focused delivery.

Andy brings a collaborative, can-do attitude to all of his projects and coaches team members to learn new skills and grow their careers.

Prior to his time at West Monroe, Andy was a director in the Healthcare vertical at PricewaterhouseCoopers. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Notre Dame and a master’s degree from Stony Brook University.
differentiation: Andy lives on Long Island, where he enjoys pursuing his various hobbies. He has a passion for home renovations and woodwork.
impact: Andy led a project which established the architecture design for provider performance metrics and incentives resulting in $6 million in medical cost savings through increased usage of in-network providers.
short_bio: Andy brings years of expertise and a proven track record delivering both strategy and delivery project efforts for Health Plan companies.

global_field.meta_description: Andy brings years of expertise and a proven track record delivering both strategy and delivery project efforts for Health Plan companies.

title: Andy Czocher
bio:
Healthcare payers face an ever more complex environment marked by evolving legislation, product models, technology, and competition. With extensive experience guiding the industry into the digital era through data analytics, customer engagement, innovation, and value transformation, Andy understands how to navigate that complexity and deliver tangible impact. He created a leading-edge clinical management and white-glove customer service product that has changed the way employers think about utilizing their payer relationship.  

He has always had a passion for helping the healthcare industry deliver faster, more efficient, and of better-quality care—and he fulfills that by developing an uncommon blend of strategy, technology, data analytics, and implementation expertise. One of his primary areas of focus has been leading product transformation efforts to implement digital first health management programs at large health clients to help lower cost and improve the health of the members they serve.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2021, he was a healthcare director with Slalom Consulting. He also spent more than a decade in Accenture’s Health Analytics practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering from the University of Illinois and an MBA from the University of Chicago.
differentiation: Andy is an avid cyclist (mostly of the indoor variety), aspiring scratch golfer, annual skier, novice scuba diver, and budding chef who is always trying new recipes and flavors. He also enjoys live music of all varieties, including attending at least one day of Lollapalooza every year since 2006.
impact:
He is active in leadership development and mentoring initiatives and aspires to find innovative ways to prepare the next generation of leaders for that challenge.  

He and his wife serve on the associate board of ALIVE Rescue (animal rescue) and host an annual charity barbeque to support the growth and operations. They also support Northwestern Settlement (community support for children and families in need) by holding an annual fundraiser and toy drive for the holidays.
short_bio: A healthcare innovator and value creator, Andy guides payers’ transformation into the digital era through strategy, data analysis, and customer engagement.

global_field.meta_description: A healthcare innovator and value creator, Andy guides payers’ transformation into the digital era through strategy, data analysis, and customer engagement.

title: Beth Montag-Schmaltz
bio:
Beth doesn’t just deliver change—she measures the intangibles of behavior change. Her work for an insurance client’s strategy and culture transformation generated positive employee sentiment: 92% agreed on the need to change to achieve long-term goals, and 94% supported the company’s new direction. And she guided an extremely difficult healthcare call-center consolidation project that drew rare positive publicity from union leadership.  

Beth loves innovation and the freedom and flexibility to create, test, and learn. She is passionate about teaming, collaborating, and creating magic—and she has done just that for countless strategic and high-risk corporate initiatives. She uses her wealth of knowledge, experience, and creative energy to guide organizations and their leaders through uniquely tailored change processes. She particularly enjoys finding common “north stars” that move groups forward.

Today, she is pioneering advances in two areas: developing best practices for measuring and tracking change initiatives across an enterprise, and building sustainable and change-capable organizations. 

Beth considers herself a serial entrepreneur. She co-founded 71 & Change—now part of West Monroe – and the proprietary change management software ChangeAnalytics. She earned a bachelor’s degree communications from Baldwin-Wallace College in Ohio and an executive MBA from the University of Washington. She is also Prosci certified.
differentiation:
Is wine tasting a hobby? Beth and her husband surely think so. They also enjoy being the (hopefully) “cool” aunt and uncle to 12 nieces and nephews. 

She enjoys walking and is a “super slow but steady” jogger. She ran Hood to Coast in 2019 and would have done it again, but….COVID-19.
impact:
With her entrepreneurial spirit, Beth founded the Pacific Northwest Chapter of the Association of Change Management Professionals and is responsible for establishing the first US-based regional ACMP community of change practitioners. 

She is passionate about charitable work and lends her time, talent, and treasure to the board of Big Brothers and Big Sisters of Puget Sound and Plymouth Housing.
short_bio: Beth is a recognized researcher, practitioner, innovator, and thought leader in the field of change management—with a track record for measurable impact.

global_field.meta_description: Beth is a recognized researcher, practitioner, innovator, and thought leader in the field of change management—with a track record for measurable impact.

title: Brian O’Donnell
bio:
The benefits of doing business in the cloud are well-established but difficult to deliver. That’s where Brian comes in. He creates best-in-class digital solutions that deliver tangible business benefits. For example, he developed the strategic plan and lead the re-engineering effort of the core operations platform for a high-growth retail SaaS company, creating a solution that can scale to 300,000 transactions weekly and manage millions of dollars in financial purchases. 

His background in enterprise architecture and cloud platforms, combined with the experience of building two cloud businesses, enables him to bring a unique blend of business and technical aptitude to clients’ challenges.

His career journey has common threads that run throughout as an entrepreneur, business leader, and technology professional. In these capacities, he has found professional fulfillment in building teams and organizational capabilities, growing strategic partnerships and channels, and collaborating with clients on initiatives that have measurable impact on performance. 

In 2006, he cofounded Attunix, a cloud services provider. Over a dozen years, he guided its growth to a firm of more than 70 people – and, just as importantly to him, one recognized as a best workplace in the region before selling it in 2018. He holds a degree in business administration from Gonzaga University.
differentiation: He enjoys being active and always learning something new. His family takes advantage of the Pacific Northwest’s abundant outdoor recreational activities. An avid traveler, his bucket list includes visiting all seven continents—with just Australia and Antarctica to go.
impact: Having been the beneficiary of great mentors, he strives to be the same for his colleagues.
short_bio: Tapping his unique mix of business and technical aptitude, Brian delivers data/analytics and software engineering solutions that have measurable impact.

global_field.meta_description: Tapping his unique mix of business and technical aptitude, Brian delivers data/analytics and software engineering solutions that have measurable impact.

title: Bryan Komornik
bio:
Bryan has more than 15 years of strategy and technology consulting experience, giving him the ability to guide healthcare organizations through complex and transformational initiatives to deliver tangible value. Bryan has built an accomplished track record in healthcare management strategy, system selection and vendor analysis, product lifecycle delivery, digital consumer and user experience design, and complex program management throughout his career.

Bryan’s focus on delivering great value for his clients is matched only by his passion for coaching and mentoring his team members on industry trends and how to face challenges in their own careers.

Bryan joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, a healthcare business and technology consultancy for which he was a senior manager. He has a bachelor’s degree from Indiana University’s Kelley School of Business.
differentiation: As parents of twin boys, Bryan and his wife spend much of their time focusing on and being present for their family and creating their own traditions. The family also enjoys traveling together, with Maui being a favorite destination. Bryan and his family live in the northern suburbs of Chicago near where his wife, a physician assistant, grew up. Bryan was a competitive bowler for more than two decades.
impact: Bryan is a featured contributor on Progressology, where he writes about balancing his demanding career with being a husband and a father of twins.
short_bio: Bryan brings more than 15 years of strategy and technology consulting experience which helps him build trust with his healthcare clients.

title: Carolyn Weiner
bio:
Carolyn is committed to building a sustainable energy future and driving change in the transportation sector – and she has results to show for it. Her utility customer energy efficiency programs have delivered more than 50 GWhs and 15 MWs in annual energy savings for industrial and agricultural companies. She led the customer acquisition strategy for a large utility’s electric vehicle charging incentive program, which signed 150 customers and 2,500 L2 chargers in the first year. And she executed a major cost-saving strategic initiative for a clean energy company that reduced operating expenses by $2 million.  

In addition to deep knowledge of the technologies and processes involved in transportation electrification and renewable energy, she has also honed the skills for delivering successful programs: the ability to execute change under aggressive time frames, engage cross-functional teams, create structure from ambiguity, and connect the dots across broad communities of stakeholders.  

Before joining West Monroe in 2021, she was a program manager with Sunrun and spent nearly nine years with Pacific Gas and Electric Company, including managing electric vehicle programs. She holds a bachelor’s degree and an MBA degree from the University of California, Davis.
differentiation: She is devoted to raising her children to be successful, empathetic individuals. Her interests away from work include traveling and experiencing other cultures, reading, learning about economics, and cooking the latest recipes from Bon Appetit – often with a kid-friendly twist. She was on her high school golf team and briefly participated in the amateur circuit.
impact: A mentor through the UC Davis Energy and Efficiency Institute, Carolyn advises the next generation of clean energy leaders. In addition, she has served on her Graduate Alumni board and the board of a faith-based organization providing her program and business management expertise; and volunteers with local food banks and animal adoption organizations.
short_bio: Carolyn’s passion for and experience in a sustainable energy future means transportation electrification benefits for both utilities and consumers.

global_field.meta_description: Carolyn’s passion for and experience in a sustainable energy future means transportation electrification benefits for both utilities and consumers.

title: Dan Howell
bio:
Designing and delivering transformational systems that make healthcare work better and provide a 3-5x ROI is the kind of impact clients have come to expect from Dan.

A seasoned management and technology consultant, Dan leads our West Coast Healthcare teams, partnering with leading healthcare organizations to develop and implement a wide range of high-impact solutions, encouraging cross-functional collaboration, and driving innovation.

Years of project leadership experience enable Dan to support clients through all phases of transformation – from market and opportunity assessment to design and planning to program execution and enhancement.

Dan joined West Monroe through our acquisition of Invoyent, a healthcare consultancy. There, he served as a partner specializing in large-scale technology integration and enterprise transformation. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University.
differentiation: Dan enjoys spending time with family, traveling, karaoke, and wine tasting. He aspires to be a guitar player and is open to lessons, tips, and encouragement.
impact: For Dan, improving healthcare is more than a day job – it’s a mission that extends to his community work. He is Board Vice President for Project Access Northwest, a not-for-profit that provides access to specialty healthcare for low-income and uninsured patients.
short_bio: Dan is a partner in our Healthcare & Life Sciences practice. He is passionate about adding value to an industry that touches so many lives.

global_field.meta_description: Dan is a partner in our Healthcare & Life Sciences practice. He is passionate about adding value to an industry that touches so many lives.

title: Dan McMahon
bio:
Sourcing products and services in complex, rapidly evolving markets requires striking the right balance of timeliness, cost, service levels, and contract flexibility. That’s Dan’s specialty. Through effective leadership, he has helped companies realize over $1 billion in value. 

His pragmatic approach to strategy, vendor evaluation, and contract development considers the financial and operational nuances of creating value. And his experience in and knowledge of the global marketplace – including United Kingdom, Europe, Asia, and India, as well as North America – produces contracts and relationships that are ready to deliver on business, financial, and performance goals. Altogether, he has led more than 30 companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and global service migration as a senior executive, external advisor, or outsourcing service provider. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a principal. As the firm’s vendor liaison, he met regularly with outsourcing providers to understand their business plans and marketplace developments. Previously, he was vice president of strategy and development with Alliance Data and held consulting roles with Infosys Technologies and Diamond Technology Partners. He earned a bachelor’s degree from the Montana State University-Bozeman and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
differentiation: He is an avid mountain biker and four-time finisher of the BC (British Columbia) Bike Race – a seven-day mountain bike stage race that, for many participants, is the culmination of a year or more of training. His side passions include Northern Plains Indian history and portfolio theory.
impact: He enjoys volunteering and is the past president of Bainbridge Lacrosse. He has published many articles on topics such as vendor management, vendor management office (VMO) design and performance, service and vendor analytics, and integrated internal/outsourced services management.
short_bio: Dan has led dozens of companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and IT and business process outsourcing – always with an eye toward value.

global_field.meta_description: Dan has led dozens of companies through strategic initiatives, acquisitions, and IT and business process outsourcing – always with an eye toward value.

title: Danielle Newman-Biczak
bio:
Delivering real impact for our clients starts inside, with an experience that is engaging and fulfilling for our people. That’s why we made employee experience a key input to our business strategy—and where Dani comes in. 

As West Monroe’s director of People Strategy & Experience, she focuses on building a differentiated employee experience that allows employees opportunities to grow and build expertise, see that their work is having an impact, and to do so in a collaborative and supportive culture. In this capacity, her key areas of focus include employee fulfillment, employee experience and people strategy, employee engagement, and internal communications. Dani is also responsible for our Corporate Social Responsibility program, focused on making a positive social impact in our local and global communities as we transition to a broader ESG framework.
 
Under Dani’s leadership, these teams have become trusted advisors to firm leadership. With her finger on the pulse of employee sentiment, Dani frequently counsels leaders on a variety of strategic and employee matters, and she partners with various functions to influence all facets of the employee experience at West Monroe. 
 
Prior to joining West Monroe in 2016, she spent more than eight years consulting with public and private companies in the areas of crisis communications, corporate communications, restructuring, litigation support, and reputation management. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Boston University.
differentiation: Dani loves interior design and real estate, travel, exploring new restaurants, and being on the water in northern Michigan. She grew up figure skating and competed in synchronized skating internationally as well as in college. She returned to the ice several years ago as a member of an adult synchronized skating team and appreciates having a competitive passion that has continued through her life.
impact: Every day, she challenges herself and her teams to think big and more critically – instead of just completing an ask or task at hand. Her aim is never just to get things done but to do them the best they can be.
short_bio: Dani is responsible for leading, creating, and driving internal communications, supporting our strategic goals and priorities.

global_field.meta_description: Dani is responsible for leading, creating, and driving internal communications, supporting our strategic goals and priorities.

title: David Babicz
bio:
With three decades of experience as a business advisor and technology leader, Dave skillfully assists organizations in optimizing their technology product delivery – from single teams to enterprises – through the application of Agile culture and practices through a variety of offerings, including assessments, training, and advising.

Dave’s background as a software development manager, Agile team leader, and database developer spans content and digital rights management, digital and print publishing, financial services analysis and reporting, customer account management, investment research, and consumer and industrial mobile applications.

A noted figure in Chicago’s Agile community, Dave is the founder and host of the Agile Angle Chicago Meetup Group and a board member of the Chicago Agile Professional Learning Network. He is a regular public speaker for a variety of associations and non-profit organizations and is equally at home in the boardroom or the classroom.

Dave joined West Monroe from Solstice Consulting, where he was an Agile transformation practice leader and delivery manager. He has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Colorado.
differentiation: Through business and personal travel, Dave has visited all 50 states and several foreign countries.
impact: Dave is passionate about volunteer work and community service. He spends hundreds of hours each year serving as a Scoutmaster with his hometown Boy Scout Troop and as a Council Officer for the Knights of Columbus, a Catholic Fraternal charitable Organization founded in 1882.
short_bio: Dave is a director in our Product Experience & Engineering practice, an experienced Agile transformation specialist, Certified Scrum Master and Certified Scrum Product Owner.

title: David Borowski
bio:
Dave’s approach to tackling complex functional transformation challenges and creating long-term value is simple: he stays grounded in the client’s unique business, culture, process, and technology environment so the solution works. This is how he has delivered more than $1 billion in cost savings, synergies, and value for his clients. He has led numerous initiatives to optimize back-office and customer-facing services, often generating savings of more than 50%. For example, he led the reimagination of the finance and accounting outsourcing strategy for a tech giant to catalyze innovation, reinvent governance, enhance service quality, and deliver savings of more than 30%. 

His background includes business process optimization and outsourcing, IT outsourcing, domestic and international operations and supply chain process improvement. His projects have transformed a multitude of functional areas, including finance, customer service, IT, procurement, contract manufacturing, HR, marketing, and sales. He has worked extensively with all leading outsourcing providers and supported clients across North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a managing director. Previously, he held operations and supply chain leadership roles with Nestle USA. He earned a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from Michigan State University.
differentiation: An avid cyclist and runner, he has competed in two marathons and climbed Mt. Rainier. He enjoys traveling, especially internationally. And when at home in Northern Virginia, he spends time with his wife and three children, enjoying the four full seasons (even if summer is a bit too long) and proximity to the cities of the Northeast.
impact: He is an advocate in the fight to cure childhood cancer. He has been nominated for Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Man of the Year, and supports the Wolfpack Childhood Cancer Foundation, an organization co-founded by his wife to provide financial and emotional support to pediatric oncology patients and their families, spread awareness, and raise funds to find cures.
short_bio: David has extensive experience evaluating, implementing, and managing both retained and outsourced business services environments globally

global_field.meta_description: David has extensive experience evaluating, implementing, and managing both retained and outsourced business services environments globally

title: David Critchley
bio:
David has a passion for solving problems and delivering tangible impact. He’s done that across many industries – particularly in the consumer and industrial products sector. For example, he partnered with senior leaders of an oil specialty products company to redesign the operating model and optimize the company’s end-to-end supply chain, producing over $100 million in annual savings. For a leading telecommunications provider, he transformed ordering, provisioning, and installation of services, improving customer delivery time by 30%. And for a power generation company, he streamlined the back-office efficiency and effectiveness of a $500 million business segment in 13 countries across Asia, Europe, and Australia. By implementing a new ERP system and redesigning critical processes leveraging shared services, he reduced back-office redundancy by 70%. 

His diverse experience ranges from supply chain optimization and operational transformation to business integration, process innovation, and research and development. 

Prior to joining West Monroe, he previously spent 12 years in industry before working in consulting roles with Accenture and IBM Global Business Services. He also owned and operated DC Squared Consulting Services. He has a degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Utah and is a Certified Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt.
differentiation:
When he has the time, he likes to boat on the lake near his home or ski in the mountains of Utah. He also enjoys golf. 

An inventor at heart, he holds two patents for technology applications in the freight rail industry. He has also earned awards for development of new methods for vacuum envelope and housing fabrication and design, as well as for project engineering and deployment leadership.
impact: He takes great pride in developing his teams and helping colleagues position themselves for success and career growth. Outside of work, he has built houses for Habitat for Humanity.
short_bio: David is an accomplished strategy and operations executive with a 20-year track record for reducing operating costs and improving bottom-line performance.

global_field.meta_description: David is an accomplished strategy and operations executive with a 20-year track record for reducing operating costs and improving bottom-line performance.

title: David Hilborn
bio:
Whether he’s advising clients on cultural impacts of an M&A transaction or harnessing technology to transform their HR function, David is committed to aligning workforce practices with his client’s strategy to increase the value created by HR.  

David is a managing partner in West Monroe’s Human Capital Management practice. He has a long track record of advising companies on organizational design, human capital management, and human resources operations.  

An experienced advisor and business leader, David has a unique blend of expertise leading consulting businesses, client relationships, and client engagements. He has worked globally and domestically with both public and privately-held organizations of all sizes. 

David joined West Monroe from Mercer, where he was a senior partner and Americas Leader and Global Chief Operating Officer for the Multinational Client Group. He held various practice and office/regional leadership roles over the course of 27 years with the organization, while also advising and overseeing services for several of their largest global and domestic clients.  

David has a bachelor’s degree in Policy and Management from Dickinson College and a master’s degree in Human Resources and Organization Development from the George Washington University.
differentiation: David is an amateur military historian. He co-authored a book published by Casemate Publishers entitled, The Fighting 30th Division. He is also associate producer for the Emmy award winning historical documentary Searching for Augusta, which aired on PBS, Netflix and Amazon Prime.
impact: David currently serves as board trustee and CEO Performance Committee chair for the Institute for Study Abroad, a leading provider of study abroad education services. David is also a volunteer and former board chairman for the March of Dimes in both Virginia and Texas.
short_bio: David leads West Monroe’s Human Capital Management team and believes in the power of people and culture to unlock value for his clients.

global_field.meta_description: David leads West Monroe’s Human Capital Management team and believes in the power of people and culture to unlock value for his clients.

title: David Watschke
bio:
David is a Senior Manager in West Monroe’s Operations Excellence practice, who specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation and overall project management. David has deep experience advising on human capital related issues participating in over 400 buy/sell side transactions for strategic and private equity buyers/sellers, spanning pre- and post-close due diligence, separation, stand-up, and integration analyses for complex, global deals.

Prior to joining West Monroe, David was a Manager with Ernst and Young’s People Advisory Services team, leading the HR team in a transformation project for a 12,000 employee global chemicals manufacturer. Leading up to that, David helped create  and manage the project management office (“PMO”) during the three-way split of an $85 billion multi-national aerospace and technology company, directing 13 HR workstreams, contracts, programs, processes, and systems/technology for 205,000 employees located in 180 countries. David also spearheaded the organization and tracking of the hiring of +1,000 back office employees for the respective business units across all functions.

Previously in his career, David worked in New York for Alvarez and Marsal and Mercer Consulting. David holds a MBA in finance from the University of Denver.
differentiation: David is an avid outdoorsman on the weekends, involving himself in hiking, trail running, camping, canoeing and other outdoor activities.
impact: David participated in the Big Brothers and Big Sisters of Chicago and continues involvement volunteering with other youth programs.
short_bio: David specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation, and overall project management.

global_field.meta_description: David specializes in human capital management (“HCM”), HR issues in M&A activity, business transformation and overall project management.

title: Elizabeth Southerlan
bio:
Healthcare operating models are evolving rapidly – and executives must make sure their operations are fit for the purpose intended and well aligned with strategic goals. That’s where Elizabeth comes in. She’s devoted her career to guiding health systems through complex transformation – all the way to tangible results. She has worked with executives of multiple East and West Coast academic medical centers, leading efforts to redesign the operating model and support organization structure – including people, processes, information flows, and digital/tech infrastructure.

Elizabeth provides strategic guidance to healthcare leaders in a range of areas: corporate and operational strategy, organizational strategic design, health equity strategy and operationalization, product and service line design and launch, M&A strategy and execution, strategic transformation, contracting and renegotiation strategy, and operational performance improvement. 

Before joining West Monroe in 2023, she was a principal with Oliver Wyman in New York. She earned a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from The Pennsylvania State University and a master’s degree in systems engineering and management from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
differentiation: When she isn’t delivering impact for her healthcare clients, Elizabeth enjoys family time – with her husband, Luke, and daughter – traveling, yoga, and reading. You may also find her at the amusement park in her Pennsylvania hometown of Hershey because she loves its great rollercoasters! She has completed more than 20 triathlons, with her most prized being the Thailand 70.3.
impact: She is passionate about supporting the next generation of leaders and has spent many years involved with employee resource group initiatives that support this. As a member of The Collective (of Health Justice Champions), she works with her national, cross-disciplinary team to imagine a new wellness ecosystem designed to honor the dignity of those who work within it and those who seek its help.
short_bio: Elizabeth partners with healthcare provider systems to identify and – more importantly – deliver value from vertical and horizontal expansion opportunities.

title: Jean Paul Baritugo
bio:
Realizing the potential benefits of transformation requires both practical design and flawless execution. That’s where JP comes in. He designed and implemented the service delivery strategy for a Fortune 20 healthcare provider to optimize its various front- and back-office operations, which included establishing a 1,200-seat Philippine global in-house center with robotic process automation capabilities across multiple customer service and finance processes that delivered $20 million in annual savings. 

His ability to develop effective business functions stems from his experience running production and other operations. For example, he ran a manufacturing facility in Juarez, Mexico – ensuring delivery of quality, cost, volume, and other requirements for the organization’s marquee consumer products clients. 

Altogether, he has led initiatives that collectively yielded over $400 million in savings – including assessments and transformations of human resources, customer service, order-to-cash, and procure-to-pay processes. He has also managed manufacturing and supply chain operations in Switzerland, the United Kingdom, Australia, Canada, Philippines, Israel, Mexico, Colombia, and Puerto Rico. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a director. Previously, he held various operational roles with Nestle, ultimately leading the Confections Division’s industrial performance. He earned a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from the University of the Philippines.
differentiation: Whether at work or in life, JP is always looking to continue honing his skills. He plays the saxophone (horribly) and the piano (atrociously) and once practiced Judo and Aikido. He also enjoys travel and is multilingual – fluent in both Spanish and Tagalog.
impact: He brings strong analytical capabilities and persistent intellectual curiosity to every project. His enthusiasm generates waves of team productivity around him.
short_bio: JP is a transformation expert and accomplished operations leader with a track record for optimizing core operations and delivering tangible improvement.

global_field.meta_description: JP is a transformation expert and accomplished operations leader with a track record for optimizing core operations and delivering tangible improvement.

title: Jennifer Davis
bio:
Jennifer focuses on partnering with health plans and ancillaries to bridge business and technical gaps to drive large-scale system implementations, develop tactical and strategic plans, and provide program oversight and governance with a level of service which enables her clients to focus on their day-to-day responsibilities.

Most recently, Jennifer served as Program Lead for the implementation of a Provider Data Management System, leveraging best practices to transform credentialing and network management business operations that enable a more efficient provider data lifecycle.  Jennifer and her team redesigned operational processes, defined business needs and requirements, and developed and executed the business testing strategy and plan (UAT and end to end integration testing).

Jennifer joined West Monroe in 2016 as part of the firm’s acquisition of Invoyent, LLC, a healthcare business and technology consultancy.  She earned her master’s degree from Cornell University’s Sloan Program in Health Administration and her bachelor’s degree from Ohio University.
differentiation: Jennifer lives with her husband and two children in Chicago, where they own a neighborhood coffee shop.
impact: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.
short_bio: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.

global_field.meta_description: Jennifer leads her teams with a passion for building the next generation of leaders through mentorship and collaboration.  As a partner to her clients, Jennifer seeks to seamlessly adapt her team’s working style to align with the needs and preferences of her clients.

title: Jennifer O’Brien
bio:
Jennifer relishes opportunities to use technology to solve business problems and deliver tangible top- and bottom-line impact—and she has a track record to back up her passion. She implemented a new pricing solution for a large retailer that targeted a $40 million annual margin benefit by improving price margins and establishing stronger pricing governance. She built a platform for a medical device manufacturer to support a new product line that has generated more than $1 billion in revenue. She also helped a product company introduce consulting services, driving a revenue increase in excess of 30%.  

Jennifer credits her success to her highly collaborative style: She's adept at bringing together multiple disciplines, complementary points of view, and diverse skills to deliver great work. 

She possesses a growth mindset and well-rounded background that spans delivery and project management, account management, and practice development—as well as experience working with leaders across the healthcare and life sciences, consumer products, retail, and high-tech sectors.  

She joined West Monroe from HCL Technologies, where she was a practice director for digital consulting. Her background includes both corporate and consulting roles. She earned a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University.
differentiation: In her spare time, she enjoys hiking and trail-running with her two dogs near her home in Boulder, Colorado, as well as traveling, exploring, and supporting her kids in their athletic and other pursuits. She holds a diploma in wine and spirts and is a Level 1 sommelier.
impact: She chairs and is a member of the Cornell University Alumni Admissions Ambassador Network. She is also the chief financial officer of a local high school lacrosse organization and has supported various local education and sports organizations over the past 15 years.
short_bio: Jennifer’s collaborative style and ability to solve business problems with technology creates tangible operational impact and enables new revenue streams.

global_field.meta_description: Jennifer’s collaborative style and ability to solve business problems with technology creates tangible operational impact and enables new revenue streams.

title: Jim McClanahan
bio:
James combines his singular technology acumen with years of practical business experience that allows him to assist clients with developing business, operational, and sales and marketing plans. He recently developed a strategic telecommunications plan to help a large utility company based in the Midwest avoid a nearly $5 million increase in its Operation and Maintenance costs.

James joined West Monroe from S&C Electric, where he most recently was director of smart grid projects. Before joining S&C Electric, he was a regional sales manager for Motorola, responsible for the reseller channel for wireless broadband B2B and B2G sales. His customers included utilities and state and local governments across five states. James has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Tulsa and a master’s degree from Oklahoma State University.
differentiation: With a background in electrical engineering, James still has a passion for electronics. He restores vintage radios and computers in his free time and is a licensed ham radio operator. He currently lives west of Atlanta with his wife, their two children, and a menagerie of dogs and horses that he’d rather not count at this point.
impact: James is a member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers and its Power and Energy Society. He also serves on the Long Range Planning Committee of the IEEE PES.
short_bio: James’ background in electrical engineering along with years of practical business experience allow him to help clients deliver results.

title: Jonathan Shaw
bio:
Jonathan enjoys the challenge of helping clients solve difficult questions by thinking creatively and bringing new perspectives. It’s hard to argue with his formula and the results it produces – including millions of dollars of direct savings for Fortune 500 companies. For example, he transformed the IT infrastructure and application development/maintenance strategy for a Fortune 200 retailer, delivering savings in excess of 40% by realigning internal and external roles and re-sourcing outsourced services. He managed design and procurement of network services and accelerated the stand-up of a physical network for a $4 billion divestiture from a manufacturing and distribution company. And he advised several US-based wireless carriers in developing and implanting interference mitigations with television broadcasters, enabling the carriers to deploy 4G and 5G cellular services more rapidly.

Whether developing and executing an IT infrastructure sourcing strategy for a global organization or managing a network cost reduction initiative to remove millions of dollars of wasteful spend per year, his tested experience and technical knowledge enable clients to maximize the value derived from their vendors’ services. Altogether, he has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for more than 50 multinational enterprises. 

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a co-founder and a director in the IT Outsourcing practice. Previously, he was a manager in Deloitte Consulting’s Telecommunications practice in London and Washington, DC, and a telecommunications analyst with West Deutsche Landesbank. He earned degrees in chemistry from Durham University.
differentiation: He has a Ph.D. in nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy. He lived in Islamabad, Pakistan, for two years but today calls Colorado home. He particularly enjoys the climate and easy access to mountains for skiing, biking, and rock climbing.
impact: He enjoys sharing his knowledge and insight – personally as a math tutor and professionally as a published author through industry journals such as InformationWeek, CIO, NetworkWorld, Network Computing, ZDnet, and CIO Insight.
short_bio: Over the course of his career, Jonathan has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for dozens of large, global enterprises.

global_field.meta_description: Over the course of his career, Jonathan has led infrastructure optimization and outsourcing projects for dozens of large, global enterprises.

title: Lorenzo De Leon
bio:
Lorenzo effortlessly shatters the stereotype of consultants as academic and formal. An energetic, hands-on technology leader, Lorenzo excels at simplifying IT complexity and communicating clearly with everyone from the C-suite to the help desk. These skills helped him succeed with high-impact technology projects, like preparing a healthcare services firm for a multi-billion-dollar acquisition and serving as interim enterprise architect for a durable medical distributor.

What makes Lorenzo especially effective is his candor. He asks the questions that others may be pondering but are hesitant to ask. He sparks conversations that foster curiosity and collaboration.

Before joining West Monroe, Lorenzo was senior principal and cloud practice leader at Trexin Consulting. He has bachelor’s and master’s degrees from the Illinois Institute of Technology.
differentiation: Lorenzo’s business problem-solving skills are refreshed and enhanced through creative pursuits including poetry, blogging, photography, and music. You can find his music on Spotify, iTunes, and bandcamp.com.
impact: Caring and compassionate in all areas of his life, Lorenzo serves on the board of JOURNEYS | The Road Home, a Chicago-area non-profit agency that provides shelter, social services, and housing to the homeless and those at risk of becoming homeless.
short_bio: A senior principal in our Product Experience & Engineering Lab, Lorenzo focuses his software engineering expertise on the financial services and healthcare sectors.

title: Michael Orehowsky
bio:
Michael offers an exemplary track record for increasing business process efficiencies through simplification and application of best practices. His ability to deliver tangible improvement is the result of his unique blend of experience and skills in operational and strategic leadership. Over the course of his career, Michael has gained deep operational experience across all facets of the retail industry.

As a culture driver in the Pittsburgh office, Michael brings organization, mentorship, calmness, and a get-it-done attitude to the Operations Excellence practice. He is also the co-lead of the employment engagement committee.

Michael joined West Monroe in 2018 from Giant Eagle, Inc., where he was a retail executive for 13 years. He has a bachelor’s degree from Penn State University.
differentiation: Michael lives north of Pittsburgh, where he shares 14 acres of land with his wife, two kids, and four dogs. The family values the secluded nature their home offers without being too far from civilization. They also love to travel; a trip exploring Iceland and staying in a new part of the island each night is a highlight.
impact: Michael is on the advisory board for Standing Firm, an organization focused on ending partner violence by empowering employers to recognize and respond to the workplace effects of partner violence.
short_bio: Michael’s operational experience across many facets of the retail industry means he brings years of experience and success to his clients.

global_field.meta_description: Michael’s operational experience across many facets of the retail industry means he brings years of experience and success to his clients.

title: Rainer Feick
bio:
With experience across industries and in all types of transactions, Rainer is ready to tackle the complexities of any merger, acquisition, divestiture, or carve-out—all with a focus on creating value through technology and operations. He supported the sell side of a $3.5 billion insurance technology transaction, the privatization of a $4 billion airline, and the carve-out and merger of two regional retail banks.  

He has led more than 75 due diligence projects, with a particular focus on software and high-tech, tech-enabled business services, and consumer and industrial products organizations. He also works with clients to develop post-transaction operating model, cost-optimization, digital/technology strategy, and value-creation strategies.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, he was a consultant in the Digital, Technology, and Operations Analytics practice of Oliver Wyman. He also spent three years in IBM’s Business Strategy & Transformation practice. He earned a bachelor’s degree in finance from Concordia University in Montreal, Canada.
differentiation: He spent 15 years abroad in France and Canada and always looks forward to returning. But he also finds plenty to appreciate close to home, including off-leash dog hour at Fort Greene Park, beautiful Brooklyn brownstone homes, and various breweries around and outside of New York City. He enjoys learning new do-it-yourself skills and spent most of 2020 rebuilding a cabin in upstate New York. He recently completed his first – and last – Iron Man competition.
impact: He brings enthusiasm and a passion for learning the intricacies of new business models and industries. He also enjoys identifying opportunities to scale businesses with software and tech-enabled processes and workflows.
short_bio: With a particular focus on the software and tech-enabled businesses, Rainer provides transaction advisory that sets the stage for value creation.

global_field.meta_description: With a particular focus on the software and tech-enabled businesses, Rainer provides transaction advisory that sets the stage for value creation.

title: Robin van Overbeek
bio:
When you need a holistic technology perspective, you want Robin on your team. Her diverse expertise along with a collaborative leadership style creates results: for instance, she managed a team that built a custom loan quote portal that decreased the time required to deliver a loan quote to 5 minutes—and also enabled the client to increase application volume, doubling the impact to their top line. 

Robin applies her experience in managed software and data engineering, digital strategy, and robotic process automation to help bring creative technology solutions to her client’s most complex business challenges. She is most fulfilled when is partnering with her clients to connect the dots between the business and technology functions so that her work positively impacts the people, processes, and culture of an organization.  

Prior to joining West Monroe, Robin was a technology consultant with Hitachi Consulting. Robin holds a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and Business from the University of Puget Sound, and is a Certified Scrum Manager and Product Owner.
differentiation: Robin’s desire to learn a diverse set of skills doesn’t stop with technology – she has a number of creative hobbies, is well traveled, loves spending time outside, and is a voracious reader. She and her husband live with their Boston Terrier Gus in Robin’s childhood home in North Seattle, which they are DIY-remodeling.
impact: A highly-collaborative leader with a passion for mentoring, Robin finds fulfillment in helping people’s individual strengths shine on both client work and internal initiatives. She is passionate about supporting other women in the technology field and ensuring our teams include a diverse range of experience and thought.
short_bio: Robin’s background in a diverse range of technology disciplines helps her bring creative thinking to her client’s business issues.

global_field.meta_description: Robin’s background in a diverse range of technology disciplines helps her bring creative thinking to her client’s business issues.

title: Shree Bharadwaj
bio:
Delivering corporate goals through data, analytics and technology takes a special combination of vision, leadership, discipline, and endurance. That’s exactly what Shree brings to the table. He’s been at the center of highly complex transformational initiatives and merger integrations for Fortune 100 companies – with many successes to show for it. For example, as chief architect at Walgreens, he led the ICD-9 to ICD-10 remediation program spanning more than 1,000 systems across key business functions. 

His track record for innovation and value creation extends more than 20 years, fueled by a focus on data and analytics strategy, enterprise architecture, data science and big data platform engineering, mobile and cloud platforms, and digital transformation. He uses that expertise today to advise private equity investors with respect to due diligence and post-close value creation for potential acquisitions or carve outs. 

In his previous leadership role with Syndigo, he led the Data and Advanced Analytics practice across 10+ acquisitions in two years. He was elected to the Global Standards Architecture board, where he collaborated with global leaders to develop standards for various industries. He holds a master’s degree in analytics from the University of Chicago and a bachelor’s degree in engineering.
differentiation: He loves playing beach volleyball and cricket and is the founder of the West Loop Cricket Association.
impact:
He is a member of Chicago Arch Angels and an advisor/mentor to multiple startups, working with founders and entrepreneurs to grow their companies.  

He also likes to teach and develop talent. He is an adjunct professor with the University of Chicago’s Master’s Analytics program and Northwestern University’s Master’s in Data Science program, for which he develops and teaches courses in data science, data engineering, and data visualization. He is also part of the Google Faculty Institute and AWS Educate.
short_bio: With a track record for employing technology to drive innovation, Shree provides leadership for creating private equity value through data and analytics.

global_field.meta_description: With a track record for employing technology to drive innovation, Shree provides leadership for creating private equity value through data and analytics.

title: Siddhartha Sharad
bio:
Siddhartha’s recipe for success is simple: strike the right balance of problem-solving intelligence (IQ), emotional awareness (EQ), and execution focus (XQ). He’s honed that formula through hands-on experience running complex transformation projects and managing business P&Ls. For example, he successfully executed the turnaround of a Pharma & Life Sciences solutions business within 15 months by updating customer service technology platform, revitalizing the workforce to deliver a better patient experience, and instilling a culture of innovation and change. Results achieved - $8 million in annual savings, 500% growth in the pipeline and a 10-point increase in client Net Promoter Scores. 

He has earned the reputation as a strategic advisor who is dedicated to client success. He brings innovation and out-of-the-box thinking to impact clients’ businesses and exceeds delivery commitments. He is particularly passionate about digital transformation and automation and has published numerous articles based on his learnings in these areas.  

He joined West Monroe from Pace Harmon, where he was a Principal in the Business Services Transformation service line. Previously, he was Vice President and General Manager with Conduent, a Fortune 500 Business Process Outsourcing and Digital Services company. He also spent more than 10 years with IBM’s Business Process Services unit, working on large scale transformation projects with Financial Services and Healthcare clients. He holds a Bachelor in Electrical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Mumbai and a Master in Business Administration from the Indian Institute of Management, Kolkata.
differentiation: Siddhartha is always up for a challenge, whether that is transforming underperforming businesses, beating his personal records in half-marathons, or completing a cross-country drive. He counts among his most memorable experiences his family’s road trip from Chicago to San Francisco and back – more than 6,000 miles over three weeks, stopping in 18 different cities. His favorite pastime is reading - history and science being his favorite topics.
impact: He is eager to develop talent and actively provides mentorship to colleagues, young and experienced alike. He also helps the Chicago area’s less fortunate residents – making sure they have access to food and shelter through volunteer activities with the Greater Chicago Food Depository and Franciscan Outreach of Chicago.
short_bio: Siddhartha is a digital transformation leader and business transformation expert who helps enterprises realize business value through technology - automation and artificial intelligence.

global_field.meta_description: Siddhartha is a digital transformation leader and business transformation expert who helps enterprises realize business value through technology - automation and artificial intelligence.

title: Tom Jones
bio:
Complex, high-stakes transactions require sound financial guidance and an experienced hand. That’s where Tom comes in. He created a forecast model to support a $240 million bond offering for a strategic acquisition, including financial schedules for the bond offering memorandum. In another engagement, he led the $30 million carveout of a life sciences business with international operations, eliminating acquisition debt by Year 3 through the divestiture of a major product line.

Tom has a track record for optimizing business operations to drive growth and maximize business value. To do so, he draws on a broad background that includes finance leadership, financial reporting, accounting, budgeting, operations, systems implementation, and M&A carveouts and integrations—as well as productivity improvement and change management.

Having several decades of financial leadership with regional and multinational companies, he knows how to integrate quickly with project teams to accelerate value. His leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills enable him to establish rapport with investors, lenders, and all levels of staff and management.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2022, he spent more than three decades in finance and accounting roles—several as chief financial officer or controller—in diverse industries, including construction, life sciences, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. He holds a degree in accounting from California State University, Northridge and is a Certified Public Accountant in the state of California.
differentiation: His favorite pastimes are spending time with family, fishing, golfing, and playing music—he’s a Beatles superfan. He loves to travel, with his favorite destinations being Hawaii and New Zealand. He played basketball with George Clooney, Jamie Foxx, and other talent while working at Warner Bros.
impact: Tom is an avid mentor who enjoys coaching to colleagues in their current roles and providing career guidance. He has supported various organizations, including the Pasadena Humane Society and as a board member of Suzanne Manlet Foundation.
short_bio: Tom brings senior financial leadership—including experience as a CFO and controller—to clients navigating the complexities of a major transaction.

global_field.meta_description: Tom brings senior financial leadership—including experience as a CFO and controller—to clients navigating the complexities of a major transaction.
